byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Chicago, and Mike McPhate from New York.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MIKE McPHATE

abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel promotes 27-year department veteran Eddie Johnson to interim superintendent of police, spurning three candidates presented by city's police board; move comes as Emanuel faces pressure to restore trust in both department and his own administration after outrage over police misconduct.
lead_paragraph: The mayor rejected three candidates that had been recommended by a police board as he seeks to repair Chicago’s relationship with its police force.

headline.main: Rahm Emanuel Picks Eddie Johnson as Chicago’s Interim Police Chief
headline.print_headline: Chicago Mayor Picks Interim Police Chief, Rejecting Board Recommendations

snippet: The mayor rejected three candidates that had been recommended by a police board as he seeks to repair Chicago’s relationship with its police force.
